QuestionStatement: Which of the following is the most fundamental issue that economics addresses?
Inflation occurs when there is a sustained increase in which of the following?
Which of the following is LEAST likely to promote economic growth?
AnswerChoices: Increase in consumption of nondurable goods
Increase in the labor force participation rate

QuestionStatement: An increase in spending in an economy will cause a multiplied increase in gross domestic product because
AnswerChoices: government spending is greater than zero

QuestionStatement: A contraction in the money supply will most likely change the nominal interest rate and aggregate demand in which of the following ways in the short run?                    Nominal          Interest Rate    Aggregate Demanda.      Increase            Decreaseb.      Increase            Increasec.      Increase            Not changed.      Decrease            Decreasee.      Decrease            Increase
If the economy is in a severe recession, which of the following policy actions is most appropriate?
AnswerChoices: Keeping the money supply constant and reducing budget deficits
Decreasing government spending and taxes by the same amount
Increasing both the money supply and government spending
Increasing both the federal funds rate and taxes
Decreasing the money supply and increasing taxes

An increase in government spending will affect the demand for money and nominal interest rates in which of the following ways?                   Demand              Nominal                  for Money                Interest Ratesa.      Increase            Increaseb.      Increase            Decreasec.      Increase            Indeterminated.      Decrease            Increasee.      Decrease            Decrease
Which of the following policies, if appropriately sized, would provide expansion during a recession with the smallest change in interest rates?
AnswerChoices: An open-market purchase of government securities by the central bank and a decrease in the federal funds rate
An open-market sale of government securities by the central bank and an increase in the federal funds rate
A decrease in taxes and an open-market purchase of government securities by the central bank
An increase in government spending and an open-market sale of government securities by the central bank
An increase in taxes and an increase in the federal funds rate

An increase in which of the following would most likely result in an increase in aggregate supply?

AnswerChoices: income distribution in each country will become more equitable
employment in each country will increase
migration from one country to the other will _increase
each country can consume beyond its _constraints of resources and productivity

The graph above shows two aggregate demand curves, AD1 and AD2, and an aggregate supply curve, AS. The shift in the aggregate demand curve from AD1 to AD2 could be caused by
AnswerChoices: a decrease in the money supply
an increase in the price level

QuestionStatement: An increase in the international value of the United States dollar will most likely benefit
AnswerChoices: domestic producers of premium wines sold to people in other countries
currency traders holding large quantities of yen
German citizens vacationing in the United States
Canadian citizens expecting to purchase real estate in the United States
retired United States citizens living overseas on their social security checks

QuestionStatement: An increase in the international value of the United States dollar will most likely benefit
AnswerChoices: An increase in the price level
An increase in the demand for money
A decrease in the supply of money
A decrease in government transfer payments

QuestionStatement: If wages are sticky, which of the following policies will be the most effective in raising real gross domestic product to the full-employment level?
AnswerChoices: Doing nothing, since there are automatic stabilizers
The sale of bonds by the Federal Reserve
An increase in the income tax
An increase in the discount rate
